cloud.jgo.net.tcp.http.jor

Class JORServer

  • java.lang.Object
    • cloud.jgo.net.tcp.TCPServer
      • cloud.jgo.net.tcp.http.HTTPServer
        • cloud.jgo.net.tcp.http.jor.JORServer
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Manageable, Server, ManageableCommands, java.lang.Iterable<Handler>, java.lang.Runnable

    public class JORServer
extends HTTPServer
    Version:
    1.0.4

    jGo.cloud/JOR


    Description :
    This technology allows you to represent java objects on the web.
    Objects are stored in a list, and the list will be passed to the jor matrix.
    Each object therefore has an associated url, obviously customizable.
    How to use it :
    1. Create a JOR server
    2. Create the objects to represent
    3. Add objects to a list or array.
    4. Create a JOR request handler
    5. Apply the JOR annotation to the class of the object you want to represent
    6. Implement the methods if necessary: JORHandlerConnection.html_represents(Object, cloud.jgo.net.tcp.http.HTTPResponse, String)-JORHandlerConnection.organizesObjectsRootPage(java.util.Map, cloud.jgo.net.tcp.http.HTTPResponse, String)


    Here is the url for general documentation :
    https://www.jgo.cloud/jor


    JOR :
    J - Java
    O - Object
    R - Rappresentation

    This class represents a server with jor technology, is an implementation of HTTPServer
    Author:
    Martire91
    See Also:
    JOR, JORHandlerConnection
